Remotely trigger the VDS DAG to convert the SEGY file to a VDS file.

exec: console.log("Stop polling conversion status. Process may be hanging.")

request.description: Check the status of the DAG to verify that conversion is finished. If the DAG is still processing, this request will retry every minute until the response no longer shows a status of "running" (up to 6 minutes). After all attempts, we will assume that the DAG is hanging and give up if we do not receive a successful status.

query.description: full path for the subproject in the seismic store

request.description: VDS conversion produces a single file, and this request will verify that the file exists after a successful conversion.

item.description:
A new OSDU instance will require certain configurations and files to perform a SEGY to VDS conversion. This group of requests will setup all requirements, including uploading a sample SEGY file to storage if necessary. These tests use a sample SEGY file provided by Equinor (*ST10010ZC11_PZ_PSDM_KIRCH_FULL_T.MIG_FIN.POST_STACK.3D.JS-017536.segy*). Be sure to download this file from [Equinor's Volve field data set](https://www.equinor.com/energy/volve-data-sharing)*, add the "example-" prefix to the file name, and then add the file to your test directory. Alternatively, you can download the sample SEGY file from this repository using git LFS.

Your SEGY file should be in the same directory as the test collection when running tests using Newman:

*   (your test directory)
    *   *.postman_collection.json
    *   *.postman_environment.json
    *   example-ST10010ZC11_PZ_PSDM_KIRCH_FULL_T.MIG_FIN.POST_STACK.3D.JS-017536.segy

If you will be using Postman to run your tests, you should set the test directory as the working directory for Postman or move the sample SEGY file to a **test** folder in the **Postman** directory

*Follow the dataset download instructions, and find them inside folder Seismic/ST10010/Stacks.

This set of tests will setup and tear down all configurations and files needed for SEGY to VDS conversion, including a sample SEGY file. User or system must provide an OAUTH token (TOKEN variable) to authenticate each request.
